cards.title: In General
content: My name is Alessandro, a Computer Science (with Management) student at King's College London.
Currently, I am a placement student working in Coventry for PCMS. I am Italian, living in Rome,
but I moved to London in 2017 to attend University. I love programming because it's very logical and I
like solving problems, creating algorithms and seeing the results of what I do in real time.

Hanging out with friends: At least once a week I go out with friends.

cards.title: PCMS
content: Experience: working for this company is improving my time management, is teaching me
how to work in a big and professional team and is getting me more and more familiar with agile
methodologies. The tools and frameworks used are also expanding my technical knwoledge.

cards.title: Web Pages
content: I learnt HTML when I was back in high school, and now I have a solid
understanding that allows me to easily create web pages. This knwoledge
is backed up also by a remarkable CSS knwoledge which, alongside Javascript,
allows me to create powerful and good looking websites.

cards.title: Node.Js
content: In order to improve the usage of Javascript, I decided to learn Node.Js:
I now have a solid understanding of how to use and what it means global
and local packages, the nvm to upgrade node, and all the main terminal commands.

content: Via Node.js I started to practice with some of its most famous packages:
React: it has been my first frontend tool. Here I learnt SCSS precompiler
Angular: (used to build this website) thanks to this framework I learnt Typescript,
practised with pipes and learnt the twoways data binding;
Ionic: I use this framework in the company I work for to turn web apps into smartphone apps;
Mocha and Jasmine: testing tools for javascript.

cards.title: Programming Languages
content: My University provided me with knwoledge in different languages including:
Java: Java has been my first OOP language. I practised a lot with it, both at University
and at work. I have a deep understanding of it and I can be very efficient. My java knowledge
extends to Java8, thus, I can easily use lambdas to make my code functional and more elegant.
I have also been trained on multi-threading (both in pseudo code and java).
C++: working with C++'s syntax, using pointers and references explicitly, had me
practising a lot on low level machine structure.
Scala: this has been my first functional language. I studied it at University for a module
it helped me learning how functional languages work and the importance of immutable collections.
Python: as mentioned in the machine learning section, my knowledge in python is pretty good,
especially when combined with main labraries such as numpy, pandas and matplotlib.
Javascript: as mentioned in the web development section, I lately gained a lot of expertise in
Javascript using it a lot both at University and work.
